content: Rebecca Eliza Gonzales, of Texas, a Career Member of the Senior Foreign Service, Class of Minister-Counselor, to be Director of the Office of Foreign Missions, with rank of Ambassador, vice Stephen Akard, resigned.
11 nominations, beginning with Lisa M. Allen, and ending with Jasmine M. Osinski
Shefali Razdan Duggal, of California, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Kingdom of the Netherlands.
4 nominations, beginning with Randy W. Berry, and ending with Lynne Marie Tracy
Monde Muyangwa, of Maryland, to be an Assistant Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, vice Ramsey Coats Day.
42 nominations, beginning with Kathy E. Body, and ending with Jessica Hunter Zaman
John N. Nkengasong, of Georgia, to be Ambassador at Large, Coordinator of United States Government Activities to Combat HIV/AIDS Globally.
Bernadette M. Meehan, of New York, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States of America to the Republic of Chile.
205 nominations, beginning with Stephen Anderson, and ending with Eugene West
Beth Van Schaak, of California, to be Ambassador at Large for Global Criminal Justice.
